content.title: Uses
content.description: Wood is commercially useful in making furniture. Traditional medicine uses this plant for the treatment of chronic cough, jaundice, stomach ache, and swelling in stomach. Toots are astringent and constipating, and are useful in diarrhea and dysentery. The bark is useful in vitiated conditions of pitta, wounds and ulcers, strangury, skin disease, gastropathy, fever and burning sensation. Also used as antiamoebic, anti-inflammatory, antinociceptive, anti-fertility.
